arts.ttl: Sunderland go second after late winner at Chelsea
arts.sum: Sunderland move into second place in the Premier League as winger Chemsdine Talbi scores a 94th-minute winner to stun Chelsea at Stamford Bridge.

arts.ttl: Enzo Maresca feels his players ‘should have managed better’ one key situation against Sunderland
arts.sum: "We started well with the ball but we were losing the second balls and against these sort of teams you have to know how to deal with that and overall we were not good enough. "We said many times that if you can't win you shouldn't lose.

arts.ttl: Wilson Isidor dedicates victory to the fans at Stamford Bridge
arts.sum: They went behind in the early stages of the game to a goal from Alejandro Garnacho, and the Sunderland striker felt that he had a difficult time with his defensive duties for the team. I'm really happy about the win and I hope we will continue like this.

arts.ttl: Toothless Chelsea were out of ideas and looked like ROBOTS without the ingenuity of one key star in 2-1 Sunderland defeat - this is why they can't win the title, writes KIERAN GILL
arts.sum: KIERAN GILL AT STAMFORD BRIDGE: With the District Line suspended at Fulham Broadway, Chelsea's fans faced a lengthy walk to get to the next nearest tube station to Stamford Bridge.

arts.ttl: Paul Merson slams Chelsea star after Sunderland defeat - 'You can't do that'
arts.sum: Chelsea lost more ground in the race for Champions League qualification after underwhelming in a home defeat to newly-promoted Sunderland and Paul Merson was less than impressed

arts.ttl: Sunderland stun Chelsea to go second in Premier League table
arts.sum: Sunderland scored a stoppage-time winner to beat Chelsea 2-1 at Stamford Bridge and climb into second in the Premier League table. The Black Cats have had a brilliant start to the season since promotion back into the top tier and earned their biggest win of the campaign so far in the capital. Regis Le Bris’ […] The post Sunderland stun Chelsea to go second in Premier League table first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Maresca slams Chelsea as ‘not good enough’ after Sunderland setback
arts.sum: Enzo Maresca has said Chelsea were ‘not good enough’ after his side lost at home to Sunderland. Chemsdine Talbi scored a dramatic winner as Sunderland snatched a 2-1 win at Stamford Bridge in the final seconds. Chelsea had led through Alejandro Garnacho’s goal inside four minutes, though conceded a soft equaliser to Wilson Isidor after […] The post Maresca slams Chelsea as ‘not good enough’ after Sunderland setback first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Enzo Maresca delivers brutally honest five-word verdict as Chelsea are humbled at home by Sunderland
arts.sum: KIERAN GILL AT STAMFORD BRIDGE: The Blues lost to a winner from substitute Chemsdine Talbi, which Maresca said should have been an 'easy situation' for his centre backs to clean up.

arts.ttl: "Not good enough": Maresca frustrated with Chelsea defence, attack after late Sunderland defeat
arts.sum: Chelsea head coach Enzo Maresca admits that his players were "not good enough" in defence or attack as they succumbed to a late 2-1 defeat to Sunderland in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Sunderland boss Regis Le Bris masterminds best-ever start after Chelsea win
arts.sum: Sunderland continued their storming start to the Premier League with a stunning 2-1 victory over Chelsea on Saturday and reached uncharted territory. Regis Le Bris' men had already picked up 14...
